com.stickycoding.Rokon
Class Texture

java.lang.Object
  com.stickycoding.Rokon.Texture
Direct Known Subclasses:
Font
public class Texture
extends java.lang.Object

Representative of each image, can exist without being loaded onto the hardware

Author:
Richard

Constructor Summary
Texture()
          Creates a Texture with no set image or dimensions
Texture(Bitmap bitmap)
          Creates a Texture based on a Bitmap object, it is recommended to have very few of these - as it takes a lot of memory
Texture(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer, int width, int height, boolean flipped)
          Creates a Texture from a ByteBuffer and given dimensions
Texture(java.lang.String assetPath)
          Creates a Texture based on an asset file

          Sets the reference to the TextureAtlas that this Texture is placed into

          Marks the Texture as containing tiled images of the same size, and seperates into rows/columns

Constructor Detail

Texture

public Texture(java.lang.String assetPath)
Creates a Texture based on an asset file

Parameters:
assetPath - absolute path to your texture image from the /assets/ folder

Texture

public Texture(Bitmap bitmap)
Creates a Texture based on a Bitmap object, it is recommended to have very few of these - as it takes a lot of memory

Parameters:
bitmap -

Texture

public Texture(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
               int width,
               int height,
               boolean flipped)
Creates a Texture from a ByteBuffer and given dimensions

Parameters:
byteBuffer - allocated ByteBuffer object containing RGBA pixel information
width - pixel width of Texture
height - pixel height of Texture
flipped - TRUE if the ByteBuffer needs to be flipped when rendered

Texture

public Texture()
Creates a Texture with no set image or dimensions

Returns:

Returns:

public TextureAtlas getTextureAtlas()
Returns:
the TextureAtlas to which this Texture has been applied, null if not set

public int getWidth()
Returns:
the width, in pixels, of this texture

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Returns:
the height, in pixels, of this texture

getType

public TextureType getType()
Returns:
an integer representative of the Type of Texture this is

getBuffer

public TextureBuffer getBuffer()
Returns:
the TextureBuffer object for this Texture, on the current active tile

Returns:
the number of tile rows in this Texture

Returns:
the number of tile columns in this Texture

public int getAtlasX()
Returns:
the Texture's X coordinates on its TextureAtlas, -1 if not set

Returns:
the Texture's Y coordinates on its TextureAtlas, -1 if not set
